fields.customfield_12310192: Changed active nodes list to not contain unhealthy nodes on the webUI and metrics.

fields.summary: RM webapp should have pages filtered based on App-state

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Blacklisted NMs appear in both "Active Nodes" and "Unhealthy nodes" on the RM UI. This should be fixed.
fields.summary: Blacklisted NMs should not appear in Active nodes list

comments.body: I didn't think that the RM supported blacklisting.  The MapReduce AM does I know, but I didn't think the RM ever got information about that from the AM.  Are you referring to decommissioned nodes?

bq. Are you referring to decommissioned nodes?
I am referring to blacklisted nodes - the nodes which have been blacklisted due to node health check scripts.

I think "blacklisting" here means "unhealthy."  And it is true that unhealthy NMs are lumped together with healthy NMs in the Active Nodes count.  I believe part of the reasoning here is that Active means "actively heartbeating" which both healthy and unhealthy nodes do.  Probably more useful if we remove the unhealthy nodes from the Active count since you can already get to an unhealthy node list from the web UI via the unhealthy nodes count link.

Yes, as others noted, we don't use the blacklisted nomenclature anymore.

It makes sense to remove those from the active nodes list.

Attached patch should fix this.

Not the most beautiful of the patches - mainly because unHealthy nodes are a part of the active node list internally and need special handling.

Renamed a few methods in RMNodeImpl as their semantics have changed since I originally wrote them.

Modified test-case and verified by looking at the output generated.
This conflicts with MAPREDUCE-3754 a little.
It does conflict with it a bit.  Also the Web Service API may also need to be updated so that it outputs data in the same way.

bq. Also the Web Service API may also need to be updated so that it outputs data in the same way
Updated web-services also. Added a test too. Didn't know that web-services had such beautiful tests ;)

MAPREDUCE-3754 is also in. Time for Jenkins.
+1 patch looks good to me.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12512921/MAPREDUCE-3760-20120201.txt
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 9 new or modified tests.

    -1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool appears to have generated 4 warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed these unit tests:
                  org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.webapp.TestNodesPage

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1748//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1748//console

This message is automatically generated.

  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool appears to have generated 1 warning messages.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Javadoc warning was because of HADOOP-8018. I am pushing this in.
Making it major because the metrics also are wrong because of the same issue.
I just committed this to trunk and branch-0.23. Thanks for the reviews, Robert and Jason.
